div.l: And eeke also for she was somdell smotirlyche
She was as dygne / as watyr in the dyche
Al ful of hokyr / and of bysmare
Hir thouht a lady shulde hir spare
What for hir kynred / and hir nortelerye
That she hadde lerned in the nonnerye
A douhter hadde they / bi twene hem two
Of twenty yer of age wᵗyth any mo
Savyng a Chylde that was of half yer age
In cradyl it lay / and was a propir page
This wenche thykke and we growe was
Wᵗyth camhed nose and eyn glreygley grey as glas
Wᵗyth bottokys broode / and brestis rounde and hye
But ryht fayr was here her / I wol nat lye
The person of the toun̄ / for she was so fair
In purpos was to makyn hir / his air
Both of his cateyl and of his mesuage
And straunge he maad / yit of hir mariage
His purpos was for to be stow hir hye
In to som worthi blood of auncetrye
For holy chirches good mot ben dispended
On holy chirche good / whiche that is descended
Therfore he wolde / his holy blood honoure
Thouh that he holy chirche / shulde devour
Grete sokene hath this myller͗e / out of doute
Of wheet and malt / al that lond abowte
And namely ther was / a grete college
Men calle it the soleer halle / of Cambrygge
Ther was her wheet and her malt I grownde
And on a day it happed / on a stonde
Seke lay the manciple / on a maladye
Of whiche men wende verraly he shulde dye
